title: Slightly UNUSUAL sans-serif?
content:
Hi,

I’m working on series of book covers that deal with prophecies, past lives, life after death, psychic stuff, mediums etc. I need to choose the right cover headline typeface.

I don’t want anything too scary looking but something that matches these delicate themes so I’m thinking it should probably be some humanist, sans-serif type since it deals women are main target here. I guess it might also be a type that’s slightly unusual (the way it’s cut or something) since these topics are unusual in itself aswell...

I tried Cora for Headlines...and it looks better than any other I tried but I know it’s not the one so It would help to hear your suggestions.

Keywords for choosing this type would be: unusual, not everyday, serious, delicate, women(?)...
author: Dot

comments.content:
For some reason, my brain says Dalliance. But that’s probably not what you’re looking for… too weird?  
Cora strikes me as _extremely_ clean-cut and “cool”, considering the topic at hand.

How about something from PSY/OPS? Their fonts might mostly specify as “just a little bit weird”. I think I’d try [Eidetic Modern](http://web.archive.org/web/20090507185441/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_eidetm.html) where the White sometimes creeps in on the black – like a past life creeps in on the present, or the “invisible” on the “visible” etc. Ha, you got a rationalization too! :o)

For display purposes there is Mystic by Terry Wudenbachs.

[http://www.p22.com/ihof/mystic.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20090507185441/http:/www.p22.com/ihof/mystic.html "http://www.p22.com/ihof/mystic.html")

“I’m working on series of book covers that deal with prophecies, past lives, life after death, psychic stuff, mediums etc. I need to choose the right headline typeface... unusual, not everyday, serious, delicate, women(?)...”

Let your readers do it. Just kidding. But I was at a party not too long ago, chatting with a person. When I asked what they did, they told me they were a psychic, which I said was really interesting. So when asked what I did, I of course said, _“You tell me!”_

Cheers!

Hi...both Dalliance and Mystic are a bit too much. Eidetic modern is much better.

I don’t want these books looking like they usually do- scary and crappy. I’d like them to look a bit more decent so I think I need a decent sans serif with some slight unusual differences in way it’s cut or something!?

Any other suggestions?

_“I think I need a decent sans serif with some slight unusual differences in way it’s cut or something!?”_

[Legato](http://web.archive.org/web/20090507185441/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=legato&x=0&y=0).
Hmmm..OK, maybe it should be juuust a little bit more unusual. /Sigh/ This one’s tough!

Altaira, Eidetic modern is the way I guess...The more I look at it the more I like it- it really looks the way you descibed it and it’s not toooo much. Can it be used for the main headline on the cover since I don’t think it’s display type??  
Or is there display type similar to Eidetic Modern?

_“Can it be used for the main headline on the cover since I don’t think it’s display type??”_  
As far as I understand things, text fonts can be used large: if it looks good,\* do it. (Hardcore text fonts will likely look a bit strange at large sizes, but sometimes that effect is desired.) It’s just that display fonts can’t be used for text.  
\* I’d try via the type tester before buying.
Maybe not unusual enough, but have you looked at our [Giacomo](http://web.archive.org/web/20090507185441/http:/www.terminaldesign.com/fonts/set/?ID=16).
